Reviews.Title: Proceed with Caution!! Not worth the $$
Reviews.Author: owlmommy
Reviews.Content: **skip to the bottom for a final update!!!I have been on a hunt for the right baby monitor system for our large 4000 sq ft + home. After finding that the top-rated analog monitors wouldn't work for a house our size (Samsung, Motorolla, etc with 900 ft range) we decided to go the wifi route.First we purchased the Withings monitors that are sold and endorsed by Apple. I didn't like that we had to use two iphones or two ipads to monitor our two children. So we called Wifi Baby to ask about their product and see if it would be a better fit. Over the phone, I asked whether monitoring was free or if there was any additional charge I would have once I bought the cameras. I was assured that monitoring is free, so I was pretty disappointed to wind up being charged an additional $14 per app to use the monitoring system after I just spent $500 on two cameras. The funny thing is that had they charged that extra fee up-front I don't think I would have minded. I was bothered by feeling that this was hidden. When I asked about it, I was told that technically monitoring is free, after you buy the app. So yeah, I guess its a matter of semantics, but one thing is obvious - I should have been told up-front when I was on the phone and clearly asking about this.So besides that, how does the 2.0 look and compare to the withings?? Stick with withings. The only feature that the Wifi Baby does better than Withings is a nicer camera picture. The Wifi camera is VERY clear in terms of image in bright day (color) or a night. The pic is really bad at sort of dusk when the camera doesnt know if it should flip between night vision or daytime. Then its not really useable. SO if your baby sleeps for late naps or at dusk, the image is bad then. Overall it has a great image most of the day/night.But ugh- the audio is soooo bad. And I don't know about you, but when I'm sleeping or doing stuff at home, I need good audio on a baby monitor. Keep in mind I have two wifibaby 2.0 monitors, so its not like I got a bad one. The audio is weak and garbled. Nothing like the withings or my analog monitors.Next deal breaker is the way the picture looks on my phone. So since I spent $500 on the two cameras, I don't like the idea of spending another $300-$700 on a big ipad to view the kids. The appeal of this wifibaby system was that I could see more than one baby at a time and have simultaneous audio from my iphone. Well do the math- once the iphone screen is divided into four quadrants, and each baby gets less than 1/4 of that, you can imagine that the image is soooo small its sort of lame and pointless. I think a good improvement would be a split screen so that parents of two kids can have at least somewhat larger pics to view. Its a shame that half of my small iphone screen was just wasted space. Besides, Im guessing most parents with a need for dual monitors will be viewing two, not four kids at a time, right??? (i.e. a 2 year old and a newborn).The mounting option and angles are lame too.... as you have to hard mount it. Ugh. But the clamshell design of the withings is pretty lame as well. What makes up for it is the withings has lots of nice bells and whistles (lullabies, temperature monitoring, etc. that I REALLY liked). You get NONE of these perks with wifibaby, but still the high pricetag.Last is the delay. I have the absolute top of the line high speed connection here and with buffering when I ran both the wifibaby and the withings simultaneously I couldn't believe how much more of a delay there was on the wifibaby. The withings audio is about 2-3 seconds faster than the wifibaby.Ultimately the truly sad part about wifi baby monitors in general (all of them, not just the wifibaby brand) is that they occasionally disconnect at night when you're sleeping, or they freeze at times, or they shut off when too many other apps are running, etc. It just happens. And it happens frequently. I don't think there is anything that can be done about it. I was running these monitors on an iphone (ATT) 5 and a 4s BOTH and had issues with both. When it comes to babies and sleeping, you want to have something reliable. The withings had many issues with the same disconnecting, etc. but far less than the wifibaby. Both brands of monitors also sometimes randomly would show an image from days earlier. So like I'm watching her sleep for a few hours, and then BAM the image changes to one from a few days ago (I know by what my baby was wearing) and freezes there!! Apparently wifi monitors do this as other moms I know have the same issue.Oh and withings is sooo easy and user friendly right from the box. The wifibaby was UGH annoying. Sort of like opening instructions that were typed up in china. The nice compensation for this is that wifibaby does have pretty resposive customer support, and aside from the mild dishonesty I mentioned earlier, they are very friendly and knowledgeable.I would NOT spend this amount of money on a product with so many flaws. If you google it seems the best wifi monitor to get is actually a FOSCAM camera which is funny since its not specifically geared toward kids but does all that the wifi baby monitor options can do yet costs a fraction of the price. I will be investing in a foscam system and saving my withings monitors as well, but returning the wifibaby monitors 100%!! Oh and also, wifibaby makes you pay shipping, etc on returns and has only a 30 day policy. With all the others you have a whole year to return and the shipping is FREE!Get a samsung 3037W or a motorolla bp36 (BOTH AMAZING!!) if the range will work for you. Otherwise if you're like me and have a huge house get a FOSCAM (based on what I have read) or from my experience thus far, get a withings.FINAL UPDATE: The ONLY video monitor that reaches in a my home 4000s feet/multi level - is the Vtech VM321 with 1000ft range. We now have two. It works great and is reliable unlike any other wifi version we have tried. Its also really cheap in my opinion!! Not the super nice picture quality like motorolla or samsung, but it works well and the pic isnt terrible. Hope this helps someone out there!!

Reviews.Title: very cool system
Reviews.Author: flyfisher32
Reviews.Content: I' m pretty technilogically iliterate but I wanted a baby monitor that my wife or I could easily view of our new baby no matter where we were.  Both my wife and I travel occasionally for our jobs so I thought it would be great to have a baby camera that allowed us to see our child whether we were in the living room or accross the country.  Needless to say this does that very easily and on all of our devices...we joke that I'm a PC and my wife is a Mac so she uses her Iphone, Ipad and Mac while I use my Android phone and my PC and they all work great with this camera.  I must say their IT support is amazing, on one phone call the very nice and knowledgeable tech support rep helped me easily set up all of our devices, set up a secure way to share access to family or fiends if we wanted to, and helped me understand how to adjust any setting in only about a half an hour and we had everything functioning on wifi.  I wish all companies had such helpful support for their products. Oh, and the night vision really works great just make sure it is set to auto and it works perfectly and adjusts instantly when you turn on and off the lights.  My only disclaimer is that I've never owned any other baby monitors so I can't give any comparative info but now that I have this one I don't know why I would ever want anything different.

Reviews.Title: Just a relabeled Y-Cam
Reviews.Author: flyboy "karlpk"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a relabeled Y-cam, which sells for about $100 less.  IT has all the same problems and shortcomings as the Y-cam.  So you can look under "Y-cam Black SD" to get a few more honest reviews about it. (Here's the spoiler, As a Y-cam it gets 2.5 stars).  Anyway here's the Pro's and ConsPro's--Nice and small, attractive-Relatively easy to assemble-Nice color picture-They don't overburden you with too much in the way of instructions or set up. I guess they figure it's all pretty intuitive.- They answer the phone when you call them.  Which you'll need to..Cons-- You pay $12.00 for an iphone app to access this on your Iphone.  But.. It only works in your house.  There are no instructions on how to set this up when you are outside the area of you home wifi.  So you will end up calling customer support.  Hence all the great reviews about their customer support.- You contact customer support/fill out a support ticket for help stating the problem and the time to be reached and someone emails you and says when they will call you back.  Then cross your fingers.  I went to bed after midnight still waiting.- The box shows a full screen Iphone picture from the camera.  Your picture will be half that size.- The software offers lots of settings where you can change things both on the Iphone App, and on the computer.  Unfortunately no where in anything included are any instructions given regarding when to change these settings and what they do.- I was actually able to get this thing running so I could see the picture on my home computer and Iphone(at home) but for about $60.00 you can get a very nice camera for watching your kid in your home, and not waste days of your life learning about port forwarding, internal and external IP addresses, Dtdns, and passwords to things you didn't even know existed on your system.Again- Notice every favorable review involved a call to customer service. It's great that they have customer service that sometimes helps you out.  Not so good when every good review is because someone had to call customer service.Follow-up:  I did end up speaking to customer service, and they were helpful.  They also sent me an email asking that I write them a favorable review on Amazon and mention the technicians name. Incidentally the phone technicians are contracted network engineers with day jobs around the country for whom this is pretty easy.  I spent an hour and a half with one, and I consider myself pretty comfortable with a computer. Anyway the system works.  It's a pain to set up, nothing intuitive here.  You have to go digging for instructions to do anything. Have fun..

Reviews.Title: Great Wi-Fi Camera
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to "spy" on my pets while I am away from home for extended periods of time. It took me approximately two weeks to receive the camera as amazon would not ship this product directly to Germany. Instead I had to ship it to the states and from there forward it to myself. I finally have the camera and it is a day two of using it. So here are the pros and cons so far:Pros:1. The camera comes with dual voltage (110-240V) as well as the plug adapters for Europe and UK, which is great for people living overseas.2. Very clear image during the day and in complete darkness.3. You can manually zoom in and out4. No noticeable delay when operated off of the home Wi-FiCons:1. Camera does not rotate so the image is fixed until someone manually moves the camera2. The image is blur if the light in the room is not bright enough or if it is not completely dark.3. Installation is a nightmare, especially with foreign routers. However, the customer support is outstanding.4. When using away from home function either on a different WiFi or 3G network, there is at least 5-7 second delay on the image.5. You have to purchase an $11.99 app to use this product on Apple devices...which is really not a con but I think it should either be included in the price or disclosed upfront.Customer support (5 stars):The WiFi baby customer support is very prompt and efficient. First, due to an unknown reason I was unable to install the software that came with the WiFi Baby cam. I contacted tech support via email, and within an hour received a response with a scheduled time for the same day to conduct screen-share and a phone conference to resolve my issue. Since I am located overseas, Gary, the tech was able to provide me with a local (German) phone number that I could call to join the conference, which saved me from paying long distance phone charges. Since I have a foreign router and all of the instructions and configurations are not in English, that made the set up process a lot more complicated. However, Gary was very patient and knowledgeable, and was able to connect the router to the camera in less than an hour even with router configurations being in a foreign language.I am not computer illiterate, but without Gary's expertise I would have not be able to get this camera up and running even with the step by step instructions provided on the website. After the setup, I received a follow up email with everything that we had accomplished...that again just indicates that they really care about their customers.So overall, the product is good and the customer service is beyond great. Will definitely recommend it to others and will buy it again in the future.

Reviews.Title: FIRE HAZARD , CAMERA MELTED!!!
Reviews.Author: daniel Pringle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last year to watch my newborn. To my absolute horror, I walked in one day, and the camera plate had gotten so hot it melted itself. I contacted the company immediately, photos included, and demanded a refund. The initial response was 'well you bought it from another website so we will have to recover the money from them first'. Pretty outraged, I asked them if they'd rather a lawsuit, or go out of pocket $250 to refund me so I could buy a camera from ANOTHER company. They promptly accomodated me. I told them I'd be reporting it to consumer affairs, AND to retail websites, as I feel its my responsibility to let other families know about this gravely concerning issue. If it happened to my camera, it could happen to someone elses. I'm personally shocked they never recalled the camera, as next time it could be a fire in someone's nursery. I sincerely hope you rethink buying this camera.

Reviews.Title: Completely dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Sea&Sun
Reviews.Content: This is a low quality frustrating product. Another review complained that one needs a computer science degree to set it up - well, I have a computer science degree, and I can testify that the camera is not only difficult to setup, but it is also unable to deliver a stable video stream. Sometimes, video stops for some reason, sometimes mobile device or PC is unable to connect to the camera, until I go through several power-unpower cycles. Save your time and money, look for another product!

Reviews.Title: Major Setup Problems - Beware if you due date is soon.
Reviews.Author: Raymond Allan Brown
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to use the monitor because the setup has been so challenging.  I have followed the directions on two different computers of mine and have had the same empty result.  Beware that if you think you are going to buy this item and quickly set it up you will be disappointed.  From what I am reading on other reviews a significant amount of buyers could not get a hold of someone by phone and had to put in a online request.  Then the wifibaby tech will have to take over your computer to set it up.  The setup manual is very difficult to use.  It appears that an intern haphazardly organized the installation manual.  I bought the item well in advance of the arrival of our baby and made two concerted efforts to get the monitor running to no avail.  Now I have a two week old and I still cannot get the monitor to work and I cannot get tech support on the phone to help.  Again, if you are close to your due date I would look at other options or buy it and forgo the installations instructions and just put in online service request in.  I hope once my product is up and running I have a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Follow Up on Problems
Reviews.Author: cliff norman
Reviews.Content: When me and the wife purchased this product I was a bit skeptical I'll admit. Upon receiving our WIFI Baby Cam I quickly got down to it and started the process. I'm not very tech savvy but I do my best to work through things to get them to work how they should. Unfortunately this was not the case with the WIFI Baby Cam. I did get it to work but not long after, it started having problems. Nothing seemed to work like it should. I quickly wrote an email to the company asking for help. To my surprise I received an email back very quickly from their tech support guru Gary. We emailed back and forth and eventually touched base with a phone call. He was very polite and helpful. After all was said and done, we spent an hour on the phone explaining everything to me and helping me set it up exactly how I needed it. Even got it to work so the Grandparents could view it from back home. Needles to say, I have not had any problems or issues with this product. Very well made and works like it should without problems. I would highly recommend this product to anyone out there. I love it and I'm very satisfied. Money well spent!!!!! Worth every penny!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Easiest to install
Reviews.Author: Safi Faruqui "Safi"
Reviews.Content: I am not one who typically reviews on Amazon, but I felt compelled to do so based upon the service of this company.  Other reviews have gone over the details of images, etc.  Know this: you can see your child or whatever it is that you bought this for clearly on your smartphone or tablet.  For most of us parents, that is the bottom line and the specs become somewhat overwhelming.  While I am electronics geek at heart, you don't need to know the technical details of this monitor: you just need to know that the monitor accomplishes what it sets out to do very well (see your child).The real reason to consider buying this monitor is the customer service.  What other company do you know staffs technical support after 5pm on weekdays and anytime on weekends?  My wife and I both work, and to have a company that understands this concept and has actual human beings you can talk to you away from business hours when normal people are actually home is phenomenal.  We have two of these monitors, and I set up a time with Gary (one of their tech guys) to call me at 730pm on a sunday night after my girls were asleep so that I could set up the monitors in peace.  He called me, was able to screen share within minutes (where they can, with your permission, log on to your computer), and helped me set up both monitors in less than 15 minutes.  There was no guesswork, as he was on the phone with me and fixing the settings on my MacBook at the same time.  For our busy life, it was perfect.There are plenty of other monitors on the market, and if you are tecnically saavy, check them out and set up your own wireless network and streaming.  If you are not, then WifiBaby will set it up for you and you are ready to start watching the kids.  It was simple, hassle free, and it works.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Incredible support
Reviews.Author: Joseph Stromberg
Reviews.Content: I would give it actually 4.5 stars.  My only complaints  are  that the camera doesn't pan, etc like some other models, the infrared sensors light up red (very dim, but enough that I felt I had to explain them to my young children).  However, the set-up was easy and the customer service was incredible.  (Their home store is the same price as on Amazon).  The service though is something key here.Case in point.  I have some technical know-how and had two cameras running in a matter of about 15 minutes.  Port forwarding for remote  might be a different matter, and if you have never ventured in your router before I could see how you would find this difficult.  I had a simple question regarding direct Ethernet connectivity and wifi range.  I opened a ticket just wanting a basic answer.  The next day my tech, Leo, contacted me directly and remoted into my PC.  He went into my router, and set up my system with static IPs (something I was going to get around to). I knew how to do all of what he did, but he was able to complete the task in about 15 minutes. He could have just emailed a yes or no, but he, and by extension the company, went the extra mile.  My point:  If you have a problem you can just arrange for help.  They provided the best service I have seen to date.

Reviews.Title: Great product and tech support.
Reviews.Author: Paul Prokop
Reviews.Content: This wifi baby cam was given to us as a gift, and it works great. I had a little trouble with remote viewing on my Android phone but their technical support was outstanding. We scheduled a screen share session and Gary from WifiBaby explained each step and was able to get remote viewing on my phone while on 4G network.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tech support and product
Reviews.Author: Charla
Reviews.Content: Great product and even greater tech support! Gary was amazing today helping us get everything back up after a power outage. We couldn't be more thrilled. Get this product and you will sleep better at night and so will your baby.

Reviews.Title: Wifi baby rocks
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: Great video and audio from where've I'm at. I love the alar features as well as pictures and record.I'm not very tech savvy and had a great experience w/ Gary the tech support guy who quickly got all my devises working great.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Service!
Reviews.Author: Tamara R.
Reviews.Content: I must say that the service for tech support is fantastic (thank you Roger!).  That was the main reason I spent more money on this camera versus others that are available.  And I am not disappointed.  They set up appointments during the evenings and weekends for us working folks and took over my MAC in order to make the adjustments necessary.  I loved it. The quality of picture is good as well and I am glad I get sound too.  I have two cameras now and can access them from anywhere I am with my iPhone.  So nice for a new nervous mommy!  The only reason I did not give it the full 5 stars is price.  It is a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: Always VERY helpful with technical support
Reviews.Author: Tired Installer "Tired Installer"
Reviews.Content: The local wifi setup is easy, but I always need help with remote viewing.  Tech support (Roger) always makes an appointment to fit my schedule and then spends all the time I need to get my cameras up and running (I have 3 cameras).

Reviews.Title: like it! excellent customer support
Reviews.Author: fitmommy
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave this camera 4 stars instead of 5 is that it cannot be used for travel in a hotel or someone else's home. It requires quite extensive set-up with your own home's router. It CAN be viewed remotely on public wifi but again, extensive set-up which this time required a call to customer support and 30 min on the phone.Image and sound are very clear.

Reviews.Title: Grampa is watching you in Santa Monica from Massachusetts
Reviews.Author: zenhole
Reviews.Content: My grandson Charles Augustine V  is 23 days old in Santa Monica. I'm his grampa in Scituate, MA. I peek in on him in his crib whenever I choose, and that's daily!  I purchased the WiFi Baby 2.0 Baby monitor so as to allow my son and daughter-in-law to monitor him in the next room. But 3500 miles away? I can hear V breathing! It's great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Kane
Reviews.Content: At first I had issues with the product, camera I received would not stay on, problem with where the power supply connected to the camera.  Gary walked me through the return process and was able to return without a problem even though I had ordered 7 months ago.  When I received the replacement camera I had everything up an running except for away mode in the app.  I contacted Gary directly as he had helped me with the returns process and he set up a call for the next evening.  Took about an hour to get everything going, Gary was very knowledgable and helpful.  Some of the best customer service I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: Very time-intensive set-up, works well ... eventually
Reviews.Author: K. Cameron
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera so that my husband and I could see our daughter during naps and sleep time while we're at work or traveling.  We followed the instructions that came with the device, and it took several tries on our own and then over 3 hours on the phone with the support staff to get it set up.  It was not an intuitive process at all - the name of the camera in the App is not intuitive, the entry of home and away ports / addresses is hard to understand and I still can't get the website to work on my computer.I was also very disappointed that after purchasing the device, then the app is an additional $11.99 which we would have to pay for twice since my husband and I have different Apple/iStore accounts.  I felt misled - the app to use the camera should have been included in the purchase price or mentioned somewhere.When it does work, I really like that could can use the device with a wide range, it shows video and a visual representation of the audio.

Reviews.Title: Many Cons to Consider
Reviews.Author: Jennifer  Om
Reviews.Content: We've been using the wifi baby for 10 weeks now, here are the cons:1) A perfectly silent room ends up sounding like it's in a wind storm because the device generates its own noise- the fan I presume- which is picked up and transmitted to the viewing device.  If you are at all a light sleeper this constant sound will keep you up at night.  You can mute it but then of course you won't hear the baby cry.2) We still can't get the device to work off of our wifi network on my iPhone- neither on a 3G network nor on any other wifi network.  My husband's Droid works perfectly fine on or off of our wifi system but my iphone only works on our home wifi system.  Perhaps we can schedule a service call but really, with an infant in the house who has time for that... and we already had to do that once to get the device up and running initially and even then we literally had to calendar an appointment with a Wifi Baby technician!3) The camera is a fixed angle. It can zoom in/out but it can't go up/down or left/right as can other other models.4) Wifi Baby doesn't have its own software so you have to purchase secondary software from an unrelated provider.  Wifi Baby recommends Sunshine Apps which we purchased- new purchases for each viewing device by the way which adds considerably to the cost of this system if you're two parents, each of whom has a phone and each of whom wants to be able to view the device from a remote location.  Sunshine Apps then sends you messages/alerts trying to solicit more funds- "donations"- saying they can no longer support their software!  So yes, Wifi Baby created a technology but not the software to run it on and the software they recommend you purchase is no longer being supported?!5) There is no feature to turn on the device when the baby makes noise (i.e. have the viewing device be in sleep mode until the baby moves/cries then light up to alert you of the activity).  As a result you must leave your viewing device on all night if you want to hear the baby when s/he cries... go back and read note 1) above as to why this is a serious deficiency!6) The device requires being screwed into wherever it's mounted rather than providing an option for a clip on.  Do you want to screw the device into your crib rails or into a stud in your wall... do you want holes in your crib or wall?!6 Month UPDATE: we've been using Wifi Baby for 6 months now.  We just switched our home router and once again after two hours of trying to set up Wifi Baby got frustrated and called for help.  Wifi Baby informed us that our one year warranty includes a ONE TIME set up assistance and if we wanted help setting it up a second time then we would need to pay a service fee. So our warranty is still valid but they won't help us.  Service FAIL. PS I've also now updated iphones to the latest 5S and Wifi Baby still doesn't work on it outside our home wifi network.  It just seems like this device wasn't built by technology people.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to set up, freezes, and scam-like warranty and app purchases
Reviews.Author: Samridhi Mehra
Reviews.Content: After purchasing Wifi baby, it took me a day and navigating my computer/router and their set up.Works fine, now what about that app?Well, you have to pay additional for that. They fail to tell you, it will work through your phone if you have set it up like a nanny cam and just use your phone's browser to look at your baby. No need for the app you just purchased. This app is not perfect and hardly works remotely.Over time, we noticed that the picture freezes, sound is behind about a few seconds.We recently moved and the application won't recognize it. I emailed customer support and got an answer saying they want an additional $19.99 if I have a new Internet connection even though we are well within their warranty. Mind you, they have NO documentation on how to do this on their site. Which makes me doubtful of their business practices when they don't want to share info with you. Anyone see this link when you purchased it? [...]

Reviews.Title: It took some time, but this is the product you want.
Reviews.Author: B. Marshall Wood
Reviews.Content: In the spirit of being brief, this is the monitor you want. Particularly if want access via your smartphone etc. Dont waste any more time than you have already, just buy this one.However, you will undoubtedly face what most others have, and perhaps the extended version that I encountered, and that is the set up can take some time and will try your patience. BUT if you have someone as talented, patient and qualified as Errol helping you with online support, then you will very pleased with your monitor and it's operation by the time you are done.You will have to request via email, phone or both, assistance in getting set up, and Errol assured me set up can be done in as little as 20 minutes. I believe him, but since I am one of those high frequency people, things like smart phones, routers, ipods, anything technical always seems to give me more glitches than most. And thus was the case here. But after three phone/internet sessions, we were up and running! Errol was easily the most amazing and supportive customer service representative that i have EVER had the pleasure (in this case) of working with.And the picture is clear, very  little delay, it looks amazing on my iphone 5 and loads very fast.  Our baby is 3 weeks old today, and we have been considering this purchase long before he was born. Wifi Baby is the Go! And if you get Errol, you will be hooked up.

Reviews.Title: Customer service issues not mentioned in other reviews
Reviews.Author: SO
Reviews.Content: The web camera works as described. Unfortunately, you must pay an additional fee for a smart phone/iPad app to view it. All of this I knew going in. (FYI the only iPhone/iPad app they provide support for has a frequent pop up asking for donations because they're going under. Glad I spent $10 on an app that is soon going to be obsolete). What I didn't expect was the issues with customer service/technical support.When the camera works, everything is great. I have owned the camera for 3 months and have had to call technical support 3 times. Each time I have had to wait an average of 3 days to have someone help me. What the other reviews don't mention is that there is a limited amount of technical support available. While they are very helpful when they do call, it does take a significant amount of time to get an appointment.I wish I hadn't have ever purchased. I had done extensive research and honestly WiFi baby is comparable to many other wifi baby monitors out there. I am going to have to buy ANOTHER monitor because every month I go 3-4 days without a baby monitor. It defeats the purpose of having a monitor.It seemed worth the extra money (instead of buying foscam) because of the Amazon reviews of great customer service. I then purchased this WiFi monitor over other comparable products because again I thought the customer service would be a valuable asset.Before purchasing keep in mind when reading so many positive Amazon reviews about stellar customer service, that every time WiFi baby helps (even after initial set up) they send you emails requesting you to write positive reviews on Amazon. Even if you didn't purchase on Amazon. WiFi Baby is clearly aware that Amazon requests are fueling their sales. It's unfortunate that they don't provide the customer service/technical support that they tell you to write about.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable.
Reviews.Author: Zara Fahim
Reviews.Content: Please don't buy this product. If you want to just give away your money, please write a check to me, thanks!This is just a glorified video camera. You can get cheaper cameras who can do that same thing (and better).The camera keeps disconnecting from my network. The only way it works again is if i unplug it and start over. The video quality if pretty horrible too. I have a dark brown couch which shows up as white!!! What's up with that?!Going to return this.

Reviews.Title: Terrible setup
Reviews.Author: Dima Gavrysh
Reviews.Content: You need to have a Computer Science degree to set it up and their customer support is atrocious: THEY give you the time when THEY are available without any regard to your schedule and the fact that you need the monitor asap. Their website is made by some amateur and is just full of screenshots and PDFs with manuals for Time Capsule etc, but NO clear instructions understandable by normal people, not IT geeks. Also, you need to get a $12 App from iTunes store to operate this monitor and it is incredibly confusing and NON functional no matter what I do. Just one example - you need to set up a dynamic DNS and other stuff, but nothing works. No phone calls were answered whatsoever during the whole day. Terrible, just terrible. I am returning this worthless thing.

Reviews.Title: Great product & technical support!
Reviews.Author: Christena M
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product so that my deployed husband could watch our daughter from Afghanistan.  I had some trouble with the initial setup on my own, but after requesting assistance from technical support we were up and running in no time...the representative even walked me through getting the app set up for the Ipad. Their response was prompt and scheduled a time to assist me based on MY schedule. Awesome customer service! My husband is now able to feel a little more connected to his family from 6,000 miles away. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding customer support
Reviews.Author: Ife Rodney
Reviews.Content: Setting up remote access requires some technical know-how and, above all, patience.  When I ran into some complications, I decided to give Wifibaby's customer support a try and literally within 5 minutes, they were able to whip everything into perfect shape.  Couldn't be happier with the level of support they provide.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great product with great customer service.
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: We love being able to use this product from our phones, ipad, laptop, wherever..whenever.  The camera is very easy to set up and the customer service is great from their tech support.I would buy this product again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Cool, but camera feed freezes
Reviews.Author: eshyder
Reviews.Content: Cons of this monitor: 5-7 second delay in feed, as well as freezing often (like every few minutes). I just didn't feel comfortable as a new mom with the likelihood that the camera would freeze, the sound was several seconds delayed. What's the point of having a monitor then? I'm in the midst of returning the camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera works great
Reviews.Author: Skye Manders
Reviews.Content: The actual physical Wifi Baby camera works great.  PIcture quality is good during the day and also at night.  There is absolutely no problem seeing our baby at night.  The microphone is incredible and picks up every last little noise.I will say that there is no way I could have set up the camera to work on our network without the help of the Wifi Baby tech support.  So, ease of setup is low.  My network consists of a verizon fios router that then goes into an Apple time capsule that functions as our wireless router.  So, I still don't really understand it, but having both devices increases the complexity of setup.  However, what absolutely saves the day is the Wifi Baby tech support.  It is no joke that they, Gary in my case, was SO helpful.  I submitted my help request online and Gary quickly contacted me, set up time to speak on the phone, and then quickly was able to set everything up himself by using a screen share program.  Gary sent me a follow up email stating all the different actions he took and all of the passwords and what the DNS addresses and ports should be.  Then, weeks later, I contacted Gary with a question and he volunteered to help me re-configure my wifi baby set up in response to my question.  So nice :)To use the camera, one really needs to use the 3rd party app....I have not checked recently, but last time I did, using an internet browser window to view the camera output didn't work so well.  In my case, it seemed to freeze after a few minutes and so I would have to refresh to get it to start again.  But, again, I have not really looked into it too much b/c I just use the app.  As other reviewers have pointed out, the app costs an additional $12 or something.  Yes, it is sorta expensive, but it is a one time cost.  As soon as you buy it, you don't think about it again.  But, make sure you have the app when you work with the Wifi Baby tech support.  They will make sure you have the app set up correctly also.I will caution also that how well the app works depends on how strong your wireless signal is in your house.  If it isn't strong, the video/audio of the app will disconnect and then reconnect periodically (when your wireless signal gets too weak).So, in a nutshell, I like using my iPhone as the monitor part b/c I ALWAYS have my iPhone on me...but it isn't like one can use the phone for anything else if you are using it as the monitor.  So, if you are at home, and want to still have your iphone available to use, might be good to use your old iPhone as the monitor :)And, last comment, don't wait until the last minute to set up the camera and app as it will take a bit of time.  I was quite pregnant when I started the setup and it made it a bit more frustrating since I was so uncomfy ;)

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work with PC!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: David Bustos
Reviews.Content: The wifibaby 3 does not work with PC.. You can connect to it using a browser but the browser will stop refreshing after 2-3 minutes and you will need to refresh the page constantly. Customer service told me to use my smart phone so i am guessing that wifibaby has no ability to work reliably on the PC.

Reviews.Title: Best support experience I have ever had (setting up the home network with the camera) - and I work in customer support.
Reviews.Author: Chuck River
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking about buying a baby camera and hoping to access it from outside of your home network (ie. to see napping / playing baby at work on your iPhone etc) - then this is the one you want. Or maybe the newer 2014 model - but definitely go with the WiFi Baby.Why?Because there are lots of cameras out there but the team at WiFi Baby Support are hands down the best guys that you are going to want to talk to when it comes to getting this thing up and running. They will walk you through the complexity of setting up the router, DDNS settings, port forwarding, all of that stuff - and have it up and running in no time.Can't recommend them highly enough and the camera itself has been great - super helpful to check on our son without disturbing the nursery.

Reviews.Title: App not included!!!
Reviews.Author: Tricia M.
Reviews.Content: It does the job and works fine. It has a nice web interface to watch on a computer. I bought this because you could watch from a smart phone or tablet. What it doesn't tell you is that the app is $12! With a camera this expensive, shouldn't they throw in the app as well?I also thought this one had a temperature sensor (it was listed as such in a product comparison I saw online) but it didn't, so I had to buy a room thermometer for our sunny upstairs room to make sure it didn't get too hot.

Reviews.Title: I returned this within a week
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: I liked being able to use my phone and ipad but sometimes the sound wouldn't come on. Also the signal wasn't very reliable. I ended up switching to a camera that doesn't use my wifi, can pan a room, and can easily add cameras,

Reviews.Title: Camera is ok, EXTRA costs are horrible
Reviews.Author: Nur Rabbat
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine, the images are clear and the sound comes with only 3 to 5 seconds delay. Unfortunately I don't like the fact that it doesn't register the room temperature like other baby cameras do; you would have to buy an extra item and configure it for that.What really gets me upset, though, is the fact that other than the camera expenses  you need to spend $12.99 to buy the app (over $25 if you have 2 phones- mommy and daddy) I just discovered that for configuring the camera I would have to pay an extra $19.99 dollar to get somebody to help me!!! First time is "included with the camera" but if you accidentally need to change the modem of your internet and need to start over again like it happened to me...I would have to spend almost 20 dollars to get somebody to help me out. CRAZY!!!

Reviews.Title: returned bc of poor sound quality
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: The video image is really good but the sound quality was terrible. Also, the app has to be open to run so uou can't do anything else on your ipad or phone if you want to see or hear your baby. It was also very difficult to set up. I returned the product.

Reviews.Title: Wifi Baby Support
Reviews.Author: Allison0523
Reviews.Content: Their support staff was very helpful and personable.  They were able to help me fix my problem in a quick way.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Carol Ducey
Reviews.Content: We purchased this monitor for our infant daughter for use in the home and while traveling. The setup on wifi was very easy - there are step by step directions on the website including a screenshot guide and a video. We contacted customer service to help with setting up the Away feature. They quickly set an appointment time at our convenience to work through the problem. Eric was extremely helpful and walked us through each step. He stayed on the line to make sure that the monitor was functioning properly. We are very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Nephelim 103
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great customer service.  The customer service rep spent an hour on the phone with me and my husband setting up my Mac Book Air, iPhone and Android devices.  He walked us through every step and helped along the way.  My in laws in Florida were watching their grandchildren over this phone in less than an hour!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for baby monitoring, and FANTASTIC customer support
Reviews.Author: John Nath
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased a second Wifi Baby monitor for our home as our family is expanding.  I never had any issues with the first Wifi Baby I bought, and since I knew what I was getting, I didn't hesitate to purchase another one.The set-up instructions are decent, but I'm not the most tech savvy person, so I ended up contacting customer support to get the camera fully functional.  When I bought the second camera, I contacted customer support again since Gary was fantastic to work with the first time, and he was able to get my second camera going THE SAME DAY I FILLED OUT A TICKET.I have a Galaxy S4 and a Xoom tablet and although you do have to spend additional money for the app, it works great for both picture quality and sound.  Gary at customer support was also able to get the camera to work when I'm not on my home wifi, so I can monitor the rooms while working, or taking the wife out for the evening.

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Erica0922
Reviews.Content: Call Customer Service from the beginning and save yourself the frustration of set-up issues. They take control of your computer screen and get you set up in no time + they modify settings so that you're set up with best possible selections. My husband and I just attached the camera to the wall and everything is working great. There's a bit of delay in the feed, but nothing to cause concern. The night vision is clear. Overall, I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Best Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Martine Domas
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love this baby monitor.  It does everything a traditional baby monitor does and more.  We can go to our neighbors house or out to dinner and still be able to check on our little one. We used this product first for my older child, then upgraded to the newer version for our new born.  Best monitor on the market period.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Steven Deewayne
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Camera!  We could not be happier with it! Great Picture and Great Sound! App works flawlessly with the camera as well as webpage through our Mac! Money well spent!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Customer Service!
Reviews.Author: Leila K.
Reviews.Content: We were cruising along using our WiFi Baby Monitor for a year when all of the sudden it stopped working. What? We just had our second baby and needed it to work like yesterday! I visited their web site, placed a ticket for the problem, and Gary very quickly set up a time to fix our problem the next day. Within 5 minutes, Gary had us up and running again! A fantastic experience with WiFi Baby's customer service!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect
Reviews.Author: A. Tena
Reviews.Content: Everything is great the only thing I would change is that it would have a on and off switch on the monitor and I wouldn't have to unplug it everytime I'm not using it. Also that it would maneuver around a little better. Not a lot of range of movement.

Reviews.Title: Costumer service - top notch - Gary Olsen
Reviews.Author: Hans Christian Jensen
Reviews.Content: Gary is fantastic - he gets it done right and quickly!!We added a third camera and Gary set it up without much fuzz

Reviews.Title: Worse customer service
Reviews.Author: Julie Vu
Reviews.Content: After reading about the product, I went ahead and purchased it. As soon as I installed the software, my computer slowed down significantly.  There's no sound on the recording. The device doesn't work on my iPhone or iPad with multiple tries. I called customer service and left tons of messages but got 0 response. Yes, ZERO response. So don't waste your money on this. I'm returning it.

Reviews.Title: Love the product and fantastic customer service
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: Purchased 2 cameras. Very easy to set up and view with wifi. Had trouble configuring everything to view remotely. Contacted customer service through their website and received a reply very quickly. Their Technical Supervisor, Gary, arranged to call me and walk me through everything. He connected to my computer and did everything for me while explaining everything on the phone as he did it. He was very knowledgable and friendly. Great customer service and fantastic customer support!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Support
Reviews.Author: Tim McGee
Reviews.Content: I wanted an wifi based monitor as the others seemed obsolete.  I should be able to see my baby anywhere, not just at home.  We chose this product based on CNETs and PCWorlds reviews.  The product is packaged well and arrives with instructions.  I was able to install it initially, but lost my connections a week later.  I scheduled a remote session with the Wifi Baby support team and within 20 minutes, had a great installation, with some settings i didn't even know were there.  I'm confident i have what i need in a baby monitor now with the application installed on 2 android phones and an iPad.  Eric on the support team did a great job.  The visuals and sound on the camera seem great.  Zooming on the phones is a nice touch.  Audio runs on about a 1 second delay it seems.My only compliants would be a better base for the camera.  If you were to install the monitor to a fixed surface using hardware, you do not have the ability to move the camera to multiple locations.  Also based on the stand, the ability to aim the camera down on a sharp angle is severely limited.  We have our rigged for now which doesn't present the nicest appearance but its getting the job done and we can move the camera to other rooms

Reviews.Title: Nanny cam
Reviews.Author: BLANCH MCNAMARA
Reviews.Content: I bought this to be able to keep an eye on my elderly parents who want their independence but they really can't be totally alone so since they live downstairs this is great I can keep an eye on them at night and still sleep in my own room.

Reviews.Title: A Winning Product
Reviews.Author: Andrew Pezzuto
Reviews.Content: Customer Service has been outstanding, the quality of picture fantastic, and the ability to interconnect PC and iOS products has been so easy for us.  Needless to say, having the security of seeing your baby when you're away from home is priceless!

Reviews.Title: Very happy!
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just purchased this system to use as a nanny cam. When we were installing the software onto our computer we ran into a slight problem and both of us not being very tech savvy, emailed in a support ticket. Within minutes we were contacted and set up an appointment with their tech guy.Once we were on the phone with their support team member (very friendly and very helpful), he took over the installation process and within 20 minutes, the camera was up and running and we had access to the video on our phones. I would definitely recommend this product to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Best Customer Support Ever
Reviews.Author: Erri
Reviews.Content: I researched a lot. Read lots and lots of reviews and decided to buy Wifibaby because of the picture quality and specially for the great customer support reviews. I got a bit scared about some people saying that it was very difficult to set it up and that you wouldn't be able to do it on your own. I'm so glad I didn't let that scare me away. Customer support is very important to me. Anyone will be able to install it because Gary is so good, prompt, caring and efficient. Super professional. I advice anyone to get this camera for the clear image and the outstanding customer support. I love the fact that I'm out but I can still access the camera and see how my baby is doing. I've seen some other friends camera's picture on night view but they are not even close to be as clear as wifibaby and they cost around same price. Plus they have an awful customer support. I am very pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Easy and So Convenient
Reviews.Author: R. Baran "Siric"
Reviews.Content: This works great, easy setup, and love the iphone app .. I do everything with my phone and the monitor is always there for me .. I can even watch it on the big screen tv with apple tv and airplay from the app ..We use the ipad at night ..killer !

Reviews.Title: Very useful
Reviews.Author: Sands
Reviews.Content: We gave this gift to the parents who brought it along for the Christmas holidays at our house.  It was great be able to have dinner together and still be checking on baby.  I am a "is the baby breathing?" grandma, so I really liked it.

Reviews.Title: Great product, harder to set up than expected
Reviews.Author: sarah
Reviews.Content: It was harder to set up than I thought it would be. However, the customer service was excellent and now it's working great. I wish they wod include the price of the app in the purchase price. I love how I can see my baby anytime, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: 3 Years and Loving It!!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Holst
Reviews.Content: We had had WiFi Baby for almost 3 years and Love it!!  The sense of security it provides my husband and I is immeasurable.  Aside from loving the capability of seeing our babies via iPhone and iPad in and out of the house, the support you receive is fabulous!  We have switched internet providers and moved houses.  During each occasion, the screen sharing and phone calls with their technical support team helped us each step of the way!  I would and have recommended WiFi Baby to all our "parent friends!"

Reviews.Title: I love this baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: Kristen
Reviews.Content: Love this baby monitor!  It has really reliable reception and I love that me and my husband can both access the camera through our iPhones.  You do have to pay extra for the app on each Iphone which isn't a big deal as long as you know that when you buy the camera.  There is about a 2 second delay in the audio feed, but not the video feed.  At first is was kind of annoying, but after using the monitor for about a month it doesn't actually bother us that much.  Great product and would highly recommend it.  Camera can zoom in really close and the quality of the video is impressive.  You can actually see the rise and fall of the baby's chest which is incredibly reassuring for a first time mom.  The technical support is also amazing.  I had a problem on a Sunday and emailed the company expecting to get a response Monday morning, but I actually received an email response 30 minutes later.

Reviews.Title: Roger Leo - Wifi Baby
Reviews.Author: AmyMoorer
Reviews.Content: Roger Leo provided me with amazing customer support in configuring my WifiBaby to ensure proper use via the internet and with my iphone. He was extremely patient and knew exactly what he was doing as a technical support person. His help was invaluable and we love the picture quality and performance thus far. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Wifi Baby
Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: Roger was most excellent!  He replied to my ticket quickly, allowed me to choose how we would set up support (email, phone, screen access) and also the date and time.  I even had to cancel and reschedule an hour before my appointment and it was no problem.  As far as the tech support went, Wifi Baby and Roger were very easy to work with.  On a scale of 1-10 my tech knowledge is around a 6.  I could see people on any scale being able to follow the tech instructions of Roger and Wifi Baby.  Do not hesitate to contact this tech support!

Reviews.Title: Great camera and awesome customer support
Reviews.Author: GeorgeLin
Reviews.Content: I went through multiple cameras and finally came across the wifi baby. I was very pleased with the app and the quality of the picture on the camera. The setup was quite difficult but Eric Berkemeier from tech support walked me through it and got it working with no problem. Absolutely awesome.

Reviews.Title: Competent, fast service
Reviews.Author: YooperInIowa
Reviews.Content: The product worked well out of the box.  I had some setup issues when trying to configure two of them for use on our network, which their technical support team was able to help me with via a remote share.  It was a nice and easy process, and far simpler than I've experienced with calling Adobe, Dell, Apple, and others for support issues. After the support call, I was emailed minutes from the conversation that documented actions taken and important settings, which will make for nice future reference.  Following correcting the problem, the service tech didn't stop...he gave me some recommended settings based on my configuration for improved performance.The grandparents can now see their grandkids sleeping when they want, and we can check in on them too at anytime.  Happy customers here.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Courtney K.
Reviews.Content: Amazing product!  It's awesome to be able to watch the baby on our phones or Ipad while we are home...and it makes you feel like you're home when you're able to watch the baby on the phone while away at work.  Excellent customer service and support too!

Reviews.Title: Product and Customer service are just fantastic all the way around!
Reviews.Author: AunnieSquish
Reviews.Content: Camera has a clear picture and great night view.  Not to mention their customer service is absolutely unbeatable! You WILL most likely need to make an appointment to get it set up, but don't worry!!! They are have flexible hours for tech support and not only are they timely, they are so friendly and helpful! Roger, who helped me, was terrific!Bottom line...Very happy and worth every penny to me!

Reviews.Title: WiFi Baby
Reviews.Author: Linds
Reviews.Content: Such a great product!  We love being able to view our baby's room while out of the house on our Iphone and Ipad.  The camera has all the features we were looking for at a reasonable price.  It is very easy to setup for a home network, but if you plan on using it while away then save yourself a headache and setup a support call.  Their tech support guy Roger is just awesome and had us up and running in no time!

Reviews.Title: WiFiBaby
Reviews.Author: Steve19
Reviews.Content: This product is amazing. It has great color and sound.One suggestion: set up a time where wifibaby can help you program it. You will be so thankful. It is a light and day difference compared to setting it up on your own.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality and service!
Reviews.Author: Grace
Reviews.Content: I recently bought this network camera to keep an eye on our home when away, as well as to see our cat (when nobody is watching!). The installation is relatively simple but I did get stumped and had to call for support. The response was immediate and the set up was complete within a few minutes for home network viewing as well as for website viewing (off network, anywhere) from any computer with internet connection, and from my iPhone! (I used an app called Baby Monitor). The quality of the picture is excellent, so much so that I am ordering a second camera to cover the rest of the living space at home.Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer service
Reviews.Author: Vince
Reviews.Content: The Monitor works great in all ligh conditions. I had trouble setting it up but the costumer service was excellent. Roger took the time needed to help set me up for home and mobile use. I would recommend this company.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product and service
Reviews.Author: Tracie
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews, but this one deserves it! We love being able to use any of our apple devices to watch our little one and view her while she is with a sitter.  However, the best part is the support we received from WiFi Baby.  We set up an appointment with Roger and he helped us greatly with setting up the camera.  We appreciated all his help and love the product !!!

Reviews.Title: Great customer service!!!!
Reviews.Author: Gen
Reviews.Content: Roger was such a great guy to speak to over the phone and help me set up my wifi baby!!! He made me feel comfortable asking him any questions I had about my setup process and he explained things to me in such a way that I can understand the process easily. I'm in the medical field and anything techie is a different language to me. The setup was painless and fast with Roger!!! I am so impressed with this company! I definitely recommend them to my family and friends!!! Thanks Roger!!!

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Rich Collins
Reviews.Content: Solid product and easy to use.  Even better than the camera is the technical support. Very fast, thorough and professional. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a modern baby camera.

Reviews.Title: best thing out there for traveling parent
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Ling
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a babycam that my husband could access from his phone or laptop while on the road traveling.  I am generally tech saavy so I considered a bunch of ip cameras on the market.  I thought I could do the configuration myself even if it was a little complicated but was happy to find WifiBaby since buying a camera made for surveillance purposes and configuring the network seemed a little annoying while I was 8 months pregnant.  I was able to set up the camera easily on our home network for viewing over our wifi by following the tutorials on the wifibaby website and the included instructions.  I did this before the baby was born.  After the baby was a few weeks old I decided to finally try to set up the outside network viewing and I almost was able to do it with the instructions online but ended up having to fill out a support ticket.  Gary was great and we set up a call within a day or two, we screenshared and he basically just set it up for me.  I probably wouldn't be able to replicate what he did so if I moved or things got reset I'd probably have to call again but it's working great for now.  Overall pretty easy to setup and good for a late term pregnant lady/new mom with very low brain capacity!I like being able to record to a miniSD card since I already have a bunch on hand from cameras and other devices.  I knew from investigating online that I would have to purchase apps for our devices to be able to view the camera so that didn't bother me.  We bought the android app tiny cam pro for my android phone and the baby monitor hd for my husband's iphone.  I actually like the ios app better (I like the visual tracking of sound) but the android app works fine too (you can turn the leds on and off within the app).  It was cool to be able to check in on the baby the first time we left him at home with someone else, even better than calling.  The camera quality is great for our purposes, I can even see my baby blinking.  Using the LEDs at night is key, it works great and the red lights don't bother my baby.  I wish there was a way to change the position of the camera through the apps like with a standard baby monitor.  We just used it while a sitter was watching the baby and the baby was juuuust out of frame.  If I could have moved the camera down just a bit I could have seen the baby.  For now we prop it up on a bookcase near the crib and wheel the bassinet right near it, when the baby is older and can reach the bookcase I see how you might need to mount it or something but for now the stand works fine.This may be a software/app issue but the camera refreshes a LOT when I'm viewing it on my android phone (Galaxy S4).  Each time it refreshes it mutes the audio.  This is annoying when I'm trying to listen in on my baby while I'm in another room.  I asked Gary about this while he was fixing my set up.  He changed some settings but it's still happening and is annoying but not a deal breaker.Pros: easy to set up on wifi network, great customer service, picture is extremely clear, you can set it to record to SD card or alert you when it senses movement, limited choice on apps - they just tell you which one to use which I likedCons: hard to set up over 3G/4G (outside my wifi network) by myself so I had to find time to contact customer support which is hard with a newborn, can't adjust the angle of the camera remotely (not really a con since I knew that in advance), the camera refreshes really often which turns off the audioOverall: The camera itself is good, the picture quality is better than I expected, it's a good size and relatively easy to set up with help from customer support.  It has worked well for us on both android and ios devices.  My husband has been able to look at the baby while he's gone which was our main goal.  If this wasn't our objective I might have gone with a traditional video and audio monitor but I'm glad we didn't.  It's nicer to be able to check on the baby from anywhere than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Great Product and Support
Reviews.Author: ThunderLizard
Reviews.Content: Product:  Works great.  It is very simple to set up.  Getting Tinycam on Android to work with Audio didn't work out of the box, but everything else worked great.  After a call to support, that is working well too.  I have had the unit for a little under a year, since just after this version came out, and have not had any issues with it.Service: I had a problem with setting up audio to work with Android devices.  After a quick request in, I got a call back and scheduled a time to work with someone in the evening to get the issue resolved.  Their support is great and they will do whatever it takes to fix the problem.I am very happy with the product and their service and would buy this product again when we need another camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Product; Fantastic Support!
Reviews.Author: Rafael K. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews for products but I feel that Wifi baby and the business supporting it are worth it.  We have tried multiple systems and all seem to have certain shortcomings but this product has all of the essential features that we were looking for.  We wanted good image clarity, good sound, multiple camera capability, remote monitoring (while away from house from smart phone/devices), and support to help if/when issues come up. A previous reviewer mentioned that the screen is split when you have multiple cameras; while this is true, that is just one way to view the video feed, all you do is just tap on the camera you want to focus on and it will be full screen, or you can even do a picture-in-picture view.  This product is a bit higher in cost than some, but it really isn't if you consider the amazing support that you receive.  While I am happy with all features of this product, I would say by far the best aspect, is the amazing help and support the company offers. They helped us set-up everything at whatever time was good for us, which is later in the evening for us due to work and baby schedules.  No other company is this flexible. And even months after the initial set-up, we made a mistake on one of the settings and they were more than happy to fix it for us.  Yes, there are some other products with more/different features, but the wife and I truly feel this is the best value out there. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Cory
Reviews.Content: Amazing product and the customer service is outstanding. For child protection and peace of mind I wouldn't buy anything else. If you have any setup or technical problems the customer service team gets back to you quick and fixes any problems you might have.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, Amazing customer service
Reviews.Author: Juan Lavista
Reviews.Content: Good value for money... however tough to connect via 3G (non wifi). Roger helped me out in a very collaborative and proffesional way... and everything went super SMOOTH! I'll definetly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: Works great and great customer support.
Reviews.Author: SC Kansas
Reviews.Content: We have not used our WiFi Baby system for very long yet but so far it works great!  We had a few issues getting it to work away from the home on cellular data in the very beginning, but with some great help from tech support everything works great now.  Please note there is about a 5 second delay with our system on cellular data normally.  I assume this varies by your internet service and cellular service.  We purchased this system for our baby monitor and so I could also see our baby at night while travelling with my job.You do have to set an appointment with tech support for help, but they are very helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: Good Product/Difficult Set Up
Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because is worked with iPhone and Android.  It had decent reviews so I gave it a shot.  Once it is set up it is awesome.  BUT....the set up can be really hard and involves port forwarding via your router.  If you have no idea what port forwarding is stop now and buy something that comes with a monitor.  Like I said it is a great product once you get it set up but is not for beginners.

Reviews.Title: GREAT customer service!
Reviews.Author: KTMac
Reviews.Content: I had some trouble to begin with. My network was in and out, which caused the camera to be unreliable. Once that got worked out, I was still having trouble with the camera connecting all the time.  I frequently got "host in down" messages and such.  HOWEVER, I emailed customer service.  A very nice representative scheduled a time with me to screen share.  He called me and then took over my screen. He went through all kinds of different settings to get everything working the way it was supposed to.  I now have connections in my house and the remote access feature is working too.  Very impressed!The quality of the picture is great. I love being able to see my little guy when he's sleeping. I can see his face clearly even when the room is pitch dark!

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer
Reviews.Author: Steve Geller
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the customer service is everything the other reviewers have stated and more.  I've dealt with a lot of customer service departments in the past and this one tops them all.As far as the product goes, I think its excellent.  The set up process is a bit cumbersome, but once up and running it is smooth.

Reviews.Title: Roger was very helpful
Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome machine I would recommend it for everyone especially tech savvy people. I could not get it set up on my own but I emailed customer service and they quickly sent me with a technician that shared my screen on my laptop and walked me through every step and basically set it up for me over screen sharing it was great!!Just know that if you want to use this camera on another router (if you travel and want to set it up at the new location) you will need to go through the steps again. So I will only keep it in one place at home no need to go through all that.Wonderful product :)

Reviews.Title: wifi baby set up
Reviews.Author: Kegnjg
Reviews.Content: Even though I haven't ventured into using the monitor yet, I can tell you how the support during the set up was.  I have a newborn and when he sleeps i have time to get things done and dictates my schedule. The support guy, Gary Olson, was kind enough to call back at a more convenient time which was so helpful.  The set up process was so easy and Gary did the share screen method and he was very patient with me.  The questions were answered in a way that was easy to understand and he didn't rush me.  I was going to return the item but tried the support ticket and it worked out great.WiFi Baby 2.0 (2013 Model) - iPhone, iPad, Android, Baby Monitor & Nanny Cam DVR. Video, Audio, Recording. Anywhere. Same Look, New Features (WFB2013)

Reviews.Title: Nice fixed camera
Reviews.Author: MrSnook
Reviews.Content: Camera is a nice fixed position camera could use a two way microphone. iPhone software that was recommended works well most of the time, But is an additional charge. Wi-Fi set up instructions were easy Internet direct access a bit more confusing for most users In my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great costumer service
Reviews.Author: jnp77
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal product. I had some issues with remote viewing set up and was pleasantly surprised to find great customer support. The customer service is cordial, effective and fast.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic service and unbeatable camera
Reviews.Author: KS
Reviews.Content: Was very nervous about having interference with other electronic equipment in the house as my house phones often cut out, found that this was unfounded.  Bought this camera six months ago and am so glad I did! Can't imagine living without it now as I mainly use wi-fi around the house, but switch to 4G when outside gardening or letting hubby view from work.  Set-up for wifi was easy - I did it myself with no problem. Downloading the identified app from the Android store also a cinch (app was free even).  Just had to do it for each phone, but used the same access port.  Getting the remote access over 4G was quite a bit trickier, but once I got customer service on the line, they got me up and running in an hour.  The expense was worth having the excellent customer service. It is nice to be able to go to sleep at night and be able to hear/see the little one.Cons: Wish it came with different attachment bases. I used to keep the camera on the top crib railing, but now the little one knows to knock it off to get mommy's attention.  The ability to angle more would be nice.  Also there is a distinct red glow from the leds, which is not bad - really it is the green power light which is truly distracting at night.  Will have to tape it to keep it from being too bright. Maybe for the next version they can move it to the back of the camera instead of the front??

Reviews.Title: great camera, excellent support
Reviews.Author: Dad
Reviews.Content: The camera is really great.  Love that we can log in on any computer, iphone or ipad (at home or away).  Had a little trouble setting it up, but the tech support was so great that I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Bought my second Wifi baby
Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: These work quite well with the Baby Monitor HD app that is mentioned in the Wifi Baby's paperwork - though I didn't like having to pay $12 for this app after spending almost $300 on this monitor. I think that the app should be free with purchase. The monitor can be configured to alert when there's movement within a certain sections of the viewed area. It can also be configured to take pictures when there's said movement and email it to an account of your choice. Instead of movement, you can also configure it to take pictures at an interval of your choice. My favorite features are the internet streaming for free (all you need to know is your public IP address) and the squelch which allows custom settings to suppress the background noise and alert you when sound surpasses the level you set. In the end, it should be priced a little lower with its lack of a two-way communication, no music playing means and non-HD camera. But I do own two, so I do like the product.

Reviews.Title: Great baby camera, awesome customer service
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I love these cameras, and I love being able to watch my baby while I'm at work. I could not figure out how to get the nanny-cam set up, so customer service called me and waled me through every step and made sure that everything was working perfectly. The customer service is amazing, this is a great product and great company.

Reviews.Title: Great Baby Monitor!!
Reviews.Author: KB1024
Reviews.Content: Love the viewing capabilities and that I can watch my daughter from anywhere I go. I have spread the word to friends and family about this camera. My motorola baby monitor is no comparison to this. The only problem I had was during set-up, the company was great and had it up and going in less than 2 minutes after telling them my issue.Great product and wonderful support team.

Reviews.Title: Good technical support
Reviews.Author: jeff wondoloski
Reviews.Content: This product sets up pretty quick and easy with a very simple 10 step guide. I purchased the overpriced app they recommended, $12 for iPhone, and it was up and running. You can use your computer or bookmark the page on your phone and that will work for free, but the app allows quick viewing of up to 4 cams with the touch of the icon.However, as soon as I left the wifi of my house is when I realized there was more to this. I was hoping to find a way around having to do the port forwarding thing since it seemed over my head. The manual does not come with any additional information on the other technical aspects this monitor provides so you have to use their website wifibaby.net. The site has plenty of support tips, but you have to weed through to find what tip you are looking for or read other peoples comments with the same problem. After searching I finally realized the info I needed was under their support icon and "nannycam" setup. Once I went their and read some info and tried to figure it out on my own I finally called their technical support and sent them an email. If you are average or less with computers or have never heard of the term port forwarding and plan to use this monitor outside of your home/wifi area (what they refer to as using it as a "NannyCam") then fill out a support ticket right away on their webpage and have them call you. Here is the rub with their support:The Negative:If you call you will have to leave a message and they will call you back mon-fri, you just have no clue when this will be. My first callback was within 30 min. The next took over an hour. So be ready to set it down and be flexible.Fill out the support ticket on their website and have them call you, unless you think you can figure it out over emails. They will again get back to you sometime that day.The Positive:The technician was extremely knowledgable and was willing to go through everything until I had it working the way I wanted. Have all your stuff and questions ready so they can help you.In summary this product sets up very easily right out of the box if you plan on using it just in your home wifi area, but if you plan on using it anywhere outside that or with 3G or setting up to get email alerts you will need some assistance more than likely. Once their support gets a hold of you they will get you all hooked up.This would have been a 5 if their manual or website explained using it outside of a wifi network more clearly but it was kind of hidden as a NannyCam feature. I believe to view any camera outside of your network you will need to go through the port forwarding process, so at least wifibaby's technicians are savvy and will get you through it.

Reviews.Title: Customer service is incredible
Reviews.Author: ryan
Reviews.Content: When we ran into an issue trying to get our router set up properly, Gary set an appointment and did a great job getting our monitor dialed in and working great.  Very professional and impressive customer service.  Thank you for making this go smooth for us.

Reviews.Title: Good product; EXCELLENT customer support!
Reviews.Author: D. Adams
Reviews.Content: Brand new to the baby world, and thus baby-related technology, I might not be best judge for ranking the actual hardware/software to other wifi cameras out there.  The picture and audio quality dazzles me enough, especially its ability to automatically shift from color to black+white to night vision as ambient light conditions change, and the wifi/3G connection is solid with minimal signal delay.  What makes this product REALLY shine, though, is the customer support.  As I attempted to make the camera accessible to my iPad/iPhone through my Qwest wifi router, it just wouldn't connect.  After walking through screen shots provided on the WiFi Baby web site and elsewhere, I eventually contacted customer support.  No waiting on hold or navigating through endless menu selections.  Instead, you fill out an online ticket (or leave a voice mail) and customer support contacts YOU within 24 hours to set up an appointment convenient to your schedule.  Eric was my guy -- called me exactly on time -- and efficiently screen-shared me through the setup in about twenty minutes.  I was fixed!
